intro: Ecbolium pubigerum, commonly known as the hairy ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in grassy or rocky habitats. Ecbolium pubigerum is primarily of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
